title: Do 80% of all written paragraphs in English feature the word 'the'? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have an article all about this and a brand new idea. The article is called Should This Be a New Letter in the Alphabet? It does say on it: 80 percent of all written paragraphs, including this one, feature the word "the." This word is the most commonly used word in the English language. So why doesn't "the" have its own symbol? So you can read the rest of the article and see what this guy is suggesting.

I would have thought just about all paragraphs in English contain the word the. But why does this qualify it for a symbol? What use would it be? To save time in writing or typing? It’s not a long word anyway. The English language is not like Chinese: we don’t have symbols for words, except for, for example, & and $, and these are only used in informal text.
